quizzes.title: The political candidate knew the issue was a hot _______, so he deferred to his chief of staff, who directed questions to the committee chairperson.
Don't let my mother watch any of those sappy movies—she cries at the drop of a _______.
When your program first started I thought it was the best thing since sliced _______.
Denise has been burning the midnight _______ trying to finish this report, so she must be exhausted.
I was excited to start taking night classes after work, but now, without enough time to devote either to school or to my job, I feel like I'm falling between _______ stools.
You’d better leave now if you want to arrive early for the exam. <u>Break a leg</u>!
You’d better _______ the books if you want to pass your exam on Friday.
I think he’ll pay you back your money – when _______ fly.
I don't mind driving this time-she's scratched my _______ plenty of times.
Duncan Smith hit the nail on the _______ when he said that the Prime Minister promised so much and yet changed so little.
At school, people always used to take the _______ out of him for having red hair.
They _______ their car at our disposal for our entire stay.
I'm sorry, I can't. I have a _______ headache.
This food is _______ the house, you don’t have to pay for it.
My parents are going to <u>hit the roof</u> if they find out we had a party here.
When I hear stories of cruelty to animals, it makes my _______ boil.
She is a rising star as a standup comedian, always able to bring down the _______ during each performance.
We paid through the _______ to get the car fixed.
Stop _______ about the bush, John! Just tell me exactly what the problem is.
I usually buy my clothes _______. It’s cheaper than going to a dressmaker.
I caught the last bus by the skin of my _______ .
It was a joke! I was pulling your _______ .
I always get _______ in my stomach before visiting the dentist.
Those smart phones are selling like _______. If you want one, you’d better buy one now before they’re all gone.
I haven’t had an accident yet but I’ve had a number of _______.
My father refused to eat meat that had been fired. He had _______ in his bonnet about causing cancer.
I dropped a _______ when talking with my best friend, and now he doesn't want to talk to me.
What the president said is not to be printed. It's _______ the record.
I can’t stand Mr. Brian. He’s always blowing his own _______ - telling everyone how good he is at everything.
He could always find _______ with something, either in my writing or in my personality.
The two groups of bullies fought tooth and _____ before the police came last night.
The complaints he received were like water off a duck’s ___________.
I couldn't think of a way to present my view so that no one would take it …….
Where were you? I have been looking for you <u>high and low</u>.
My little house is <u>spick and span</u>
Working irregular hours is all <u>part and parcel</u> of being a journalist.
The opposition will be elected into government at the next election, without a ________ of a doubt
He <u>didn’t hat an eye</u> when he realized he failed the exam again.
They are getting married. They have just ______ the news to their friends.
In the future, the robot will not cost an ______ and a leg.
I could see the finish line and thought I was <u>home and dry</u>.
Don't let all this praise go to your _______.
He was arrested on the _______ on the way to the airport.
It never rains but it _____.
She always turned her term paper in at the eleventh _____.
Boss: So, Rita, you left work early yesterday?       Worker: Yeah, and did I ever get in hot water for that!
A: What did you think of Chuck?    B: Oh, we hit it off right away.
quizzes.a: argued as soon as they met.

quizzes.title: We don't go there often - just off _______ on.
I'm worried she may be getting cold ______ about our trip to Patagonia.
We ______ good time and were at the hotel by lunchtime.
If everyone chips _____, we'll be able to buy her a really nice present.
It’s a ______date. I have never gone out with him before.
I don’t have anything in common with my brother. We’re like chalk and ______.
If you need me, just call me. I can come at the drop of a ______.
They simply didn’t know what they were doing and they were led by the _______ by a manipulative government.
The old man has been _____ his head for at least a year.
I’ve got to <u>run an errand</u>. I’ll be back in a minute.
They ignore people who _________ the traffic lights.
No one will _____ off the handle for no reason.
Only allowing half an hour to get from the station to the airport is cutting it _____, isn’t it?

We’ve known you are a good swimmer – stop <u>putting on an act</u>.
Four soldiers have faced charges since the scandal <u>came to light</u> last fall.
I really put my ______ in it when I asked her about her job. I didn’t know she’d just been fired.
The rest of the team complained that Sarah wasn’t _____ her weight.
I have to work at two jobs to make _____ meet.
I think I must explain to her that she got hold of the wrong _____ of the stick again.
Although a deal has been agreed, it is not yet ______-and-dried.
We had better keep on our _____ while we’re walking along the dark portions of this street.
I don’t want to see a movie now, I have _____ mind going to the park.
It seems that Charles will give it up. I suppose he is a lost ______.
You’re _____ to be late if you don’t hurry.
James sometimes seems quite unfriendly but _____ heart he’s a good person.
woman said that she would know the thief by ______ if she ever saw him again.
She takes _____to do everything well.
Mary broke a dining-room window and had to face the _____.
Tommy is the ________ sheep in his family: he is the only member who has not made a success of his life.
He argued with her until he was _______ in the face.
It was a ______-letter day when she finally received her graduation diploma.
My sister became ______ as a ghost when she saw the man at the window.
She passed her exam with flying ____ and now wants to go out and celebrate.
My sister was always the teacher's ____ when she was in the first grade at school.
Drop me a ______ when you get there.
This is where I grew up. I know this area like the back of my ______.
I'll be back in the twinkling of ____.
I'm afraid hip hop isn't my cup of ____.
Just a moment. I've got the answer on the ____ of my tongue.
Oh, I'm sorry. I shouldn't have said that. I guess I really put my ____ in my mouth.
Sharon always sticks her __________ into everyone else’s business.
In Florida, the temperature drops below freezing only once in a __________ moon.
Brady’s surprise party is going to be great if you don’t let the _____ out of the bag.
Someone who is inexperienced is ___.
The sheep were huddled into a ____ to protect them from overnight frosts.
My English is progressing______.
When you do something, you should _________.
quizzes.c: weigh up the pros and cons

quizzes.title: The weather is going to change soon; I feel it in my ______

He travels___ for 20 years and then he decided to return home.
Remember to appreciate what your friends do for you. You shouldn’t take them______________.
I know his name, but I can’t recall it at the moment. It’s on the tip of ______.
The sixth time he called me at night was the______.
Now that they have read it in_______. they believe me.
I couldn't believe that they were brothers. They were as different as_______.
It is raining_______.
They tried <u>in vain</u> to save enough money to buy a house and so finally they rented one.
You shouldn’t worry about the exam because you have prepared well and you will probably find it a <u>piece of cake</u>.
My son would love to have a Buzz Lightmonth toy for his birthday. Do you have any at your store? - Sorry, madam. They are <u>out of stock</u>.
You certainly couldn’t call him modest because he is always <u>blowing his own trumpet</u>.
I invested all my money in that failed company and now I find my whole investment has gone <u>down the drain</u>.
As far as Alex was concerned this was <u>the last straw</u> and he vowed he would never risk money on a horse ever again.
I would advise you to do that as well and in that way you will <u>kill two birds with one stone.</u>
quizzes.c: get two things done at the same time

quizzes.title: I suppose she was <u>the apple of your eye</u> at the time.

When my girl friend and my brother got in a fight I had to help my brother because blood is _____________ than water.
Whenever that professor says something I don't like, I have to bite my ________________.
Sorry I was late for the meeting today; I got stuck in traffic. -- That's okay; better late than ____________.
Don't tell me how to do this; show me because Actions speak louder than ____________.
I'd like to do something to change the world but whatever I do seems like a drop in the _____________.
I think the time has now come when we'll simply have to <u>call it a day</u>.
All right then if you like <u>I'll put my cards on the table</u>.
quizzes.b: I'll tell you what to do
quizzes.d: I'll tell you my honest opinion

quizzes.title: Well in the first place all the windows are broken, which is <u> a real pain in the neck</u>.
Yes, I agree but at the same time it's not <u>the end of the world</u>.

quizzes.a: the one with the sense of humor
quizzes.b: the one with a bad reputation
quizzes.c: the one who is always late

quizzes.title: I wouldn’t say I never see <u>eye to eye</u> with my employers but sometimes they can make extraordinary demands.

It is pointless to persuade him - a ______ can't change its spots.

Just grab a green tea biscuit. It is ______.

quizzes.c: get back to the drawing board
